title: " Beginner's Gardening Guide: Grow Your First Garden Like a Pro in Just 90 Seconds! "

subtasks: Choose climate-appropriate and easy-to-grow plants (e.g., tomatoes, basil, marigolds)
Gather essential gardening tools and equipment (trowel, fork, pruners, gloves, watering can)
Prepare garden area (weed removal, debris clearance)
Plan garden layout (in-ground beds, raised beds, containers based on space and needs)
Decide on starting from seeds or seedlings
For seeds: plant at correct depth, follow spacing guidelines (from packet)
For seedlings: harden off before transplanting
Water plants gently, ideally morning or late afternoon
Apply mulch for moisture retention and weed suppression
Fertilize with organic options (e.g., compost, fish emulsion)
Prune plants regularly for growth and pest management (use natural remedies like neem oil)
Harvest vegetables and herbs when mature (cut flowers in the morning)
